meanings.definition: To utter a low, guttural sound like a frog.
meanings.sent1: The frog began to troak softly by the pond.
meanings.sent2: I heard the frogs troak as I walked through the marsh.
meanings.sent3: The frog troaked a lullaby to the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden floorboards seemed to troak in protest with each step.
meanings.sent5: The troaking of the frogs filled the night with a soothing melody.

meanings.definition: A croaking noise made by a frog.
meanings.sent1: The troak of the frog echoed through the swamp.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't sleep because of the loud troak outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The troak of the frog interrupted the peaceful silence of the night.
meanings.sent4: The troak of the frog was a symphony in the wetlands.
meanings.sent5: The sudden troak of a frog startled me as I walked by the pond.

meanings.definition: To speak in a hoarse or croaking voice.
meanings.sent1: After catching a cold, he could only troak out a few words.
meanings.sent2: She troaked out her lines in the school play, sounding like a frog.
meanings.sent3: The tired old man troaked his complaints to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent4: Her troaking voice added an eerie atmosphere to the ghost story.
meanings.sent5: The troaking of his voice made it difficult for others to understand him.
